title: Metroticket Calculator for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Survival
description: Predicts 3 and 5-year survival after liver transplantation for patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), especially those not meeting Milan Criteria. Uses tumor size, number, and vascular invasion status.

parameters.name: largest_nodule_size
parameters.description: Size of the largest vital tumor nodule in millimeters

parameters.name: vascular_invasion
parameters.description: Presence or absence of vascular invasion

result.name: survival_prediction
result.description: Predicted 3-year and 5-year survival rates after liver transplantation

ranges.description: Sum of size (cm) + number ≤7, no vascular invasion
ranges.interpretation: Excellent prognosis with 5-year survival rate of approximately 71.2%. These patients have outcomes comparable to those within Milan criteria and are good candidates for liver transplantation.

ranges.description: Sum of size (cm) + number >7 or vascular invasion present
ranges.interpretation: Lower survival rates compared to up-to-seven criteria. Individual survival prediction varies based on specific tumor characteristics. Consider multidisciplinary evaluation for transplant candidacy.

references: Mazzaferro V, Llovet JM, Miceli R, et al. Predicting survival after liver transplantation in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma beyond the Milan criteria: a retrospective, exploratory analysis. Lancet Oncol. 2009 Jan;10(1):35-43.

Mazzaferro V, Sposito C, Zhou J, et al. Metroticket 2.0 Model for Analysis of Competing Risks of Death After Liver Transplantation for Hepatocellular Carcinoma. Gastroenterology. 2018 Jan;154(1):128-139.

Lei JY, Wang WT, Yan LN. "Metroticket" predictor for assessing liver transplantation to treat hepatocellular carcinoma: a single-center analysis in mainland China. World J Gastroenterol. 2013 Nov 28;19(44):8093-8.
formula: Up-to-Seven: Sum of largest tumor diameter (cm) + number of tumors ≤7. Survival prediction based on tumor characteristics matrix.
notes: Developed from 1,556 patients who underwent liver transplantation for HCC in 36 European centers
The 'up-to-seven' criteria applies only in absence of macrovascular invasion
Provides individualized survival predictions rather than dichotomous in/out criteria
Less widely validated than original Milan criteria
Metroticket 2.0 also incorporates AFP levels for improved prediction
